H0.text: Low altitude fog results from the combination of low humidity and abundant sunshine that characterizes the Nevada climate.

H1.text: Rapid evaporation results from Nevadaâ€™s low humidity and abundant sunshine.

H2.text: High elevation snowfall is most likely the result of Nevada's low humidity and abundant sunshine.

H3.text: Frequent thunderstorms are the most likely result of the combination of low humidity and abundant sunshine in the Nevada climate.

A4.text: If the air already has a high concentration of the substance evaporating, then the given substance will evaporate more slowly.

A5.text: The amount of light will affect the evaporation. When photons hits the surface area of the liquid they can make individual molecules break free and disappear into the air without any need for additional heat.
